headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  FRIEDMAN, JACK B

lead_paragraph: FRIEDMAN--Jack B. Long-time science educator, co-founder and past president of the National Center for Science Education, has died of heart failure at age 88. He first taught biology at the Bronx High School of Science, and was the founding chairman of the Science Department at Syosset, NY High School. After retirement, he continued teaching biology at Nassau Community College and Hofstra University. He was a passionate advocate for teaching scientific principles in schools, with evolution an important example. Jack was happily married for 60 years to Betty, and was a loving and devoted father and grandfather. He is survived by his beloved children Warren and Fran, his adored grandchildren Jesse and Sarah Strigler, and his dear in-laws Laura and Burt Klayman. Memorial donations may be made at the NCSE.com website.
